data.name: Investigative Science
data.definition: The process of asking focused questions, designing experiments, and using observations to improve understanding.
common_misconceptions: Investigation is only about finding new facts
Science is static and does not evolve
data.confusion_points: Difference between simple observation and investigative questioning
data.prerequisite_gaps: Basic understanding of scientific inquiry from previous grades

data.name: Microorganisms
data.definition: Tiny organisms that can be beneficial or harmful, playing roles in digestion, medicine production, and causing infections.
common_misconceptions: Microorganisms can be seen with the naked eye
data.confusion_points: Understanding the dual role of microorganisms as both beneficial and harmful
data.prerequisite_gaps: Basic knowledge of cells and organisms

data.name: Electric Current
data.definition: Flow of electric charge used in various applications like heating and powering machines.
common_misconceptions: Electric current is the same as voltage
Electricity is only used for lighting
data.confusion_points: Difference between electric current and other electrical concepts like voltage and resistance
data.prerequisite_gaps: Basic understanding of electricity from previous grades

data.name: Nutrition and Health
data.definition: The role of nutritious food, exercise, medicines, and vaccines in maintaining health and fighting infections.
common_misconceptions: Exercise is not necessary if you eat healthily
data.confusion_points: Understanding the comprehensive approach to health involving multiple factors
data.prerequisite_gaps: Basic knowledge of human body systems and health

data.name: Fundamental Forces
data.definition: Forces that govern physical phenomena, including those that enable electricity and magnetism.
common_misconceptions: Forces are only related to motion
data.prerequisite_gaps: Basic understanding of physical forces and their effects
